page.title: 10THE TOXTETH RIOTS
page.content: 1In 1981 Toxteth, which comprises much of our 12 sq. km. block was the scene of the{worst mainland rioting in the {history of Great Britain.}As a prelude to the Toxteth Riots there had been unrest in other areas with large racial minorities notably in{Brixton {in London and St. Paul's in Bristol. The attempted arrest by police of some black men in the Liverpool 8 area started a series of night time riots involving{stone throwing mobs}of predominantly white youths faced by large numbers of{police in riot gear, carrying shields.{Petrol bombs}were thrown and large numbers of injuries were sustained on both sides. At the height of the rioting the{Rialto,}an old cinema converted to a furniture warehuose was{burnt to the ground. {Looting}of shops was rife with the {Lodge Lane}shopping area worst hit.
